GOD.content: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)
GOD.linkedContent: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)

GT.content: division or double engenders many other dehiscences  > virtually to infinity
GT.linkedContent: division or double engenders many other dehiscences > virtually to infinity

LOBL.content: double bind, double invagination, double obligation, double demand, w/out end, no reconciliation

H.content: Oedipus is twice encrypted, 1st in dying, 2<sup><small>nd</small></sup> in hiding his death > by demanding he be kept dead, he announces a piece of blackmail
H.linkedContent: Oedipus is twice encrypted, 1st in dying, 2nd in hiding his death > by demanding he be kept dead, he announces a piece of blackmail

SPOM.content: endless chase after double as brother, wants to classify can only chase
SPOM.linkedContent: endless chase after double as brother, wants to classify can only chase

POO.content: duplicity in a ceremony, being-double, “hollows itself out in an infinite abyss:” one is neither friendly nor polite if one obeys the rules
POO.linkedContent: duplicity in a ceremony, being-double, “hollows itself out in an infinite abyss:” one is neither friendly nor polite if one obeys the rules

POO.content: the duplicity before the rule makes one tremble, an other who will seek to hold you back or push you into void, save you or lose you, supposing there ever a choice?
POO.linkedContent: the duplicity before the rule makes one tremble, an other who will seek to hold you back or push you into void, save you or lose you, supposing there ever a choice?

PAS.content: double pas provokes double instantaneous but interminable preterition, forms a singular limit btwn keeping and loss, remembering and forgetting
PAS.linkedContent: double pas provokes double instantaneous but interminable preterition, forms a singular limit btwn keeping and loss, remembering and forgetting

S.content: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, he doesn’t shelter “spirit,” a hospitality w/ reservations, quotations call for another word unless they re-call the other under the same

S.content: Geist is always haunted by its Geist, a ghost is always the other’s ventriloquist; metaphysics always returns in the sense of a revenant, Geist is the most fatal figure of revenance: the double which can never be separated from the single > spirit is its double
S.linkedContent: Geist is always haunted by its Geist, a ghost is always the other’s ventriloquist; metaphysics always returns in the sense of a revenant, Geist is the most fatal figure of revenance: the double which can never be separated from the single > spirit is its double

S.content: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to the flame it divides
S.linkedContent: double mark, doubly remarkable trait [engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, affinity w/ Schlag]: it is the spirit in which it inscribes itself, traces itself, belongs to the flame it divides

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s teleiopoesis, a messianic structure, we establish ourselves as heralds & precursors [of ‘community of those w/out community’?], Nietzsche sometimes says “I” and sometimes “we”: singular responsibility is always double [contretemps], doubled, disseminated: double as infinitely divided responsibility
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s teleiopoesis, a messianic structure, we establish ourselves as heralds & precursors [of ‘community of those w/out community’?], Nietzsche sometimes says “I” and sometimes “we”: singular responsibility is always double [contretemps], doubled, disseminated: double as infinitely divided responsibility

POOF.content: friendship–enemy btwn logic of unconscious & logic of lie: these 2 logics can’t help but haunt each other, et de partager même le concept de cette hantise qui travaille le langage de notres temps
POOF.linkedContent: friendship–enemy btwn logic of unconscious & logic of lie: these 2 logics can’t help but haunt each other, et de partager même le concept de cette hantise qui travaille le langage de notres temps

FSW.content: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility
FSW.linkedContent: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility

TC.content: [Derrida’s interpretation?] “grammar” of theater of cruelty will always remain inaccessible limit of a re-presentation that is not repetition, that is full presence, doesn’t carry it’s double w/in itself as death, a present outside time, a nonpresent > [instead?] present harbors its “intestine difference” in the interior fold of its original repetition, in representation, in dialectics
TC.linkedContent: [Derrida’s interpretation?] “grammar” of theater of cruelty will always remain inaccessible limit of a re-presentation that is not repetition, that is full presence, doesn’t carry it’s double w/in itself as death, a present outside time, a nonpresent > [instead?] present harbors its “intestine difference” in the interior fold of its original repetition, in representation, in dialectics

F.content: crypt’s impenetrability, crypt’s failure to prevent seeping, its angular inscriptions run along a divided line of “fantasmatic doubleness”: each fantasy “double and opposed”
F.linkedContent: crypt’s impenetrability, crypt’s failure to prevent seeping, its angular inscriptions run along a divided line of “fantasmatic doubleness”: each fantasy “double and opposed”

F.content: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)
F.linkedContent: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)

FWT.content: [re: responsibility as experience of inheritance] a double before (devant), to come before as in debt and before as in what is to come, always anachronism: devancer in the name of what came before, and devancer the name itself! [la devance, “owingness”]
FWT.linkedContent: [re: responsibility as experience of inheritance] a double before (devant), to come before as in debt and before as in what is to come, always anachronism: devancer in the name of what came before, and devancer the name itself! [la devance, “owingness”]

WM.content: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales
WM.linkedContent: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales

DS.content: le double parricide [Plato’s]: Homer (for mimetic poetry), Parmenides (for neglecting mimesis > his logos, the “paternal thesis” would prohibit doubling)
DS.linkedContent: le double parricide [Plato’s]: Homer (for mimetic poetry), Parmenides (for neglecting mimesis > his logos, the “paternal thesis” would prohibit doubling)

DS.content: specularity of eidos > logos—speech < mirroring [repetition ordered by resemblance (homoiōsis), doubling as duplication]
DS.linkedContent: specularity of eidos > logos—speech < mirroring [repetition ordered by resemblance (homoiōsis), doubling as duplication]

DS.content: internal division w/in mimēsis, double of itself, destined to mime or mask itself, everything played in paradox of supplementary double
DS.linkedContent: internal division w/in mimēsis, double of itself, destined to mime or mask itself, everything played in paradox of supplementary double

DS.content: never has anteriority of 1st (simple) over 2nd (double) been displaced by a metaphysical system, double de-presents, il le multiplie par suite, le double vient après le simple, the flesh & blood, l’image survient à la réalité > this is ontology
DS.linkedContent: never has anteriority of 1st (simple) over 2nd (double) been displaced by a metaphysical system, double de-presents, il le multiplie par suite, le double vient après le simple, the flesh & blood, l’image survient à la réalité > this is ontology

DS.content: priority of art over nature still privileges order 1 then 2, the preference, the precedence (pré-séance) of the imitated
DS.linkedContent: priority of art over nature still privileges order 1 then 2, the preference, the precedence (pré-séance) of the imitated

DS.content: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” > hymen
DS.linkedContent: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” > hymen

DS.content: Mallarmé’s mimicry: a double of nothing simple, a double nothing anticipates—or at least a double of another double; for this double, reality is death, it never breaks the glass
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s mimicry: a double of nothing simple, a double nothing anticipates—or at least a double of another double; for this double, reality is death, it never breaks the glass

DS.content: Mallarmé is more patient, subtle, discreet, efficient, does not suppress the double (make it dialectical, bringing us back to presence, to perception of the thing itself)
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé is more patient, subtle, discreet, efficient, does not suppress the double (make it dialectical, bringing us back to presence, to perception of the thing itself)

DS.content: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]
DS.linkedContent: “event” (historical event, if you wish) has form of a repetition, the mark (readable because doubled) of a quasi-tearing (quasi-déchirure), a dehiscence [etymology of dehiscence follows]

DS.content: Derrida always returning to Freud’s Das Unheimliche (1919)—double, repetition, blurring of borders btwn “imagination” & “reality,” “symbol” & “thing it symbolizes”
DS.linkedContent: Derrida always returning to Freud’s Das Unheimliche (1919)—double, repetition, blurring of borders btwn “imagination” & “reality,” “symbol” & “thing it symbolizes”

DS.content: supplementary double will always defy & baffle criticism, always one extra rejoinder, one recess or representation too many, and thus too few
DS.linkedContent: supplementary double will always defy & baffle criticism, always one extra rejoinder, one recess or representation too many, and thus too few

DS.content: replication of tissue and a re-folding
DS.linkedContent: replication of tissue and a re-folding

DS.content: (to be continued) in The Uncanny, Freud is most attentive to undecidable ambivalence, play of double, though he separates fictional uncanny from the feeling itself
DS.linkedContent: (to be continued) in The Uncanny, Freud is most attentive to undecidable ambivalence, play of double, though he separates fictional uncanny from the feeling itself

DS.content: M (at once male/maternal) an upside-down double V
DS.linkedContent: M (at once male/maternal) an upside-down double V

POS.content: double writing, double gesture, double science, a writing in/of itself multiple [Derrida explains that the phase of overturning the hierarchy of an opposition is necessary, politically necessary, there are risks of rushing to neutralization, but to remain w/in this phase isn’t enough]
POS.linkedContent: double writing, double gesture, double science, a writing in/of itself multiple [Derrida explains that the phase of overturning the hierarchy of an opposition is necessary, politically necessary, there are risks of rushing to neutralization, but to remain w/in this phase isn’t enough]

OS.content: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double
OS.linkedContent: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double

OS.content: l’autre geste, le plus difficile, le plus inouï, le plus questionnant, celui pour lequel nous sommes le moins préparé, can only be sketched (esquisser), announced in calculated fissures of metaphysical text: 2 texts, 2 hands, 2 visions (together simultaneously & separated)
OS.linkedContent: l’autre geste, le plus difficile, le plus inouï, le plus questionnant, celui pour lequel nous sommes le moins préparé, can only be sketched (esquisser), announced in calculated fissures of metaphysical text: 2 texts, 2 hands, 2 visions (together simultaneously & separated)

OTO.content: Dionysus vs. Crucified, name of versus, countername, suffices to pluralize (in a singular fashion) homonymic mask & proper name, to lead all threads of name astray in labyrinth (ear)
OTO.linkedContent: Dionysus vs. Crucified, name of versus, countername, suffices to pluralize (in a singular fashion) homonymic mask & proper name, to lead all threads of name astray in labyrinth (ear)

OTO.content: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine

OTO.content: Nietzsche’s “I am a Doppelgänger”: a contradiction of “double” beyond negativity of dialectical opposition, Blanchot’s Pas au-delà, a single pas, beyond opposition life/death
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s “I am a Doppelgänger”: a contradiction of “double” beyond negativity of dialectical opposition, Blanchot’s Pas au-delà, a single pas, beyond opposition life/death

OTO.content: the ear is uncanny, can become double, large or small; Freud says the infant can’t close it
OTO.linkedContent: the ear is uncanny, can become double, large or small; Freud says the infant can’t close it

ATIA.content: radical evil and double figure of animal: innocent or demonic, apocalyptic
ATIA.linkedContent: radical evil and double figure of animal: innocent or demonic, apocalyptic

PS.content: for Artaud, thief > great invisible Other, furtive persecutor doubles me everywhere: God
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, thief > great invisible Other, furtive persecutor doubles me everywhere: God

PS.content: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]

PS.content: for Artaud, furtive differance slipped in btwn 2 forms of writing, placing life outside the work, and making its origin (flesh) the epigraph, the breathless (essoufflé) sarcophagus of my discourse > only through writing made flesh, theatrical hieroglyphic, could double be destroyed
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, furtive differance slipped in btwn 2 forms of writing, placing life outside the work, and making its origin (flesh) the epigraph, the breathless (essoufflé) sarcophagus of my discourse > only through writing made flesh, theatrical hieroglyphic, could double be destroyed

O.content: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)
O.linkedContent: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)

O.content: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs
O.linkedContent: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs

O.content: repetition w/out identity, one mark inside, the other outside deconstructed system: double reading, double writing, double science: structure itself is worked in turn
O.linkedContent: repetition w/out identity, one mark inside, the other outside deconstructed system: double reading, double writing, double science: structure itself is worked in turn

O.content: double topography, double face, overwritten erasure of Hegel’s preface [undeclared double mark?]
O.linkedContent: double topography, double face, overwritten erasure of Hegel’s preface [undeclared double mark?]

O.content: dissemination sets up a pharmacy, can’t count by 1’s, 2’s, 3’s — everything starts w/ dyad (not conflictual, hierarchical, dual oppositions)
O.linkedContent: dissemination sets up a pharmacy, can’t count by 1’s, 2’s, 3’s — everything starts w/ dyad (not conflictual, hierarchical, dual oppositions)

O.content: two/four & the “closure of metaphysics” no longer take, never could take, the form of circular line enclosing a field, finite culture of binary oppositions
O.linkedContent: two/four & the “closure of metaphysics” no longer take, never could take, the form of circular line enclosing a field, finite culture of binary oppositions

O.content: ontospeleology, another name for mimetology, is not mimesis, an enigma of redoubtable power, but an interpretation of mimesis that misapprehends/distorts logic of double [cf. p. 36]
O.linkedContent: ontospeleology, another name for mimetology, is not mimesis, an enigma of redoubtable power, but an interpretation of mimesis that misapprehends/distorts logic of double [cf. p. 36]

O.content: if one is captive to formulas and absolute knowledge, can’t think anything outside the whole, not even its mimetic double
O.linkedContent: if one is captive to formulas and absolute knowledge, can’t think anything outside the whole, not even its mimetic double

REST.content: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them
REST.linkedContent: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them

REST.content: what if, and Derrida sees it too, they’re 2 left shoes, a double that fudges (brouille) both “pair & identity” à la fois—paralyzes directionality, fait loucher vers le diable
REST.linkedContent: what if, and Derrida sees it too, they’re 2 left shoes, a double that fudges (brouille) both “pair & identity” à la fois—paralyzes directionality, fait loucher vers le diable

REST.content: no symbolic contract in case of double that does not form a pair > not 1 (même) chose in 2, but a 2 in identity
REST.linkedContent: no symbolic contract in case of double that does not form a pair > not 1 (même) chose in 2, but a 2 in identity

REST.content: Heidegger: from hypokeimenon to subjectum, Roman thought takes over (übernimmt) Greek words w/out corresponding co-originary experience, absence-of-ground (Bodenlosigkeit) of Western thought opens w/ this translation > a transfer, über, over and beyond Greek experience
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger: from hypokeimenon to subjectum, Roman thought takes over (übernimmt) Greek words w/out corresponding co-originary experience, absence-of-ground (Bodenlosigkeit) of Western thought opens w/ this translation > a transfer, über, over and beyond Greek experience

REST.content: these words become ghostly (fantômatiques) doubles of themselves, leur simulacre légers, walk above/in the void, bodenlos
REST.linkedContent: these words become ghostly (fantômatiques) doubles of themselves, leur simulacre légers, walk above/in the void, bodenlos

REST.content: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use

REST.content: pair: a doubling that is a narrowing (resserrant), plus strict, plus étroit
REST.linkedContent: pair: a doubling that is a narrowing (resserrant), plus strict, plus étroit

REST.content: [re: Heidegger’s stance that a picture is useless to apprehend the useful] this reason doubles up (se dédouble): un mouvement d’entrelacement du lacet: 1) the interlacing of lace w/ itself 2) incompletely laced (entre-lacé), entrouvert (half-open) 3) figurer of lace interlaced with what is figured
REST.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger’s stance that a picture is useless to apprehend the useful] this reason doubles up (se dédouble): un mouvement d’entrelacement du lacet: 1) the interlacing of lace w/ itself 2) incompletely laced (entre-lacé), entrouvert (half-open) 3) figurer of lace interlaced with what is figured

REST.content: Heidegger’s argument hangs (tient) on 2 reasons that double each other, remarkable mode of interlacing: one reason marked in the other or in itself
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s argument hangs (tient) on 2 reasons that double each other, remarkable mode of interlacing: one reason marked in the other or in itself

REST.content: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself
REST.linkedContent: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself

REST.content: disparate: that which opens up fort: da of shoe size (pointure), possibility of dis-pairing, play of dis/appearing > double, Doppelgänger, not pair (unadaptable to walking [à la marche])
REST.linkedContent: disparate: that which opens up fort: da of shoe size (pointure), possibility of dis-pairing, play of dis/appearing > double, Doppelgänger, not pair (unadaptable to walking [à la marche])

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: [subject] ‘desists’ because must confront at least 2 figures (or one figure that is at least double) > destabilizing Lacan’s imaginary/symbolic
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: [subject] ‘desists’ because must confront at least 2 figures (or one figure that is at least double) > destabilizing Lacan’s imaginary/symbolic

PIO.content: double blow, the same blow: fabulous invention becomes invention of truth
PIO.linkedContent: double blow, the same blow: fabulous invention becomes invention of truth

PF.content: passivity marks all unconditional pure events (gift, forgiveness, hospitality, death), marks and thus doubly limits most active, productive performativity
PF.linkedContent: passivity marks all unconditional pure events (gift, forgiveness, hospitality, death), marks and thus doubly limits most active, productive performativity

EJQB.content: that which was impossible for classical rationalists: to proceed w/in duplicity of God’s questionability > God is not truthful: accede to virtue of lie
EJQB.linkedContent: that which was impossible for classical rationalists: to proceed w/in duplicity of God’s questionability > God is not truthful: accede to virtue of lie

AFR.content: Condillac resists opposition btwn continuist/discontinuist, evolutionist/epigeneticist histories (deconstructs them almost by itself) > double gesture: generates a new science & theory of general conditions for upsurge of a theory [new science]
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac resists opposition btwn continuist/discontinuist, evolutionist/epigeneticist histories (deconstructs them almost by itself) > double gesture: generates a new science & theory of general conditions for upsurge of a theory [new science]

AFR.content: for Condillac, bad metaphysics is frivolous, hollow signs, purely verbal; Condillac had to guard his discourse from frivolity as if from its infinitely alike double [doppelgänger]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, bad metaphysics is frivolous, hollow signs, purely verbal; Condillac had to guard his discourse from frivolity as if from its infinitely alike double [doppelgänger]

AFR.content: a “stretched sense” always risks being empty, [the analogic of the sign], means we never escape 2 imaginations, 2 identities, 2 metaphysics, 2 barbarisms > always a double or stand-in for idea itself: frivolity’s last/first garment
AFR.linkedContent: a “stretched sense” always risks being empty, [the analogic of the sign], means we never escape 2 imaginations, 2 identities, 2 metaphysics, 2 barbarisms > always a double or stand-in for idea itself: frivolity’s last/first garment

LI.content: what is re-markable about the mark includes margin w/in mark > mark is remarkable in that it “is” also its margin
LI.linkedContent: what is re-markable about the mark includes margin w/in mark > mark is remarkable in that it “is” also its margin

LI.content: line of margin can never be determined rigorously: divides the dividing-line & its unity at once > iterability allows for “negative” double, lie, also conditions so-called “positive” values
LI.linkedContent: line of margin can never be determined rigorously: divides the dividing-line & its unity at once > iterability allows for “negative” double, lie, also conditions so-called “positive” values

TN.content: dissymmetry of se toucher toi makes “you” the touchable (untouchable) pole of an apostrophizing address
TN.linkedContent: dissymmetry of se toucher toi makes “you” the touchable (untouchable) pole of an apostrophizing address

OG.content: to think writing first, a perversion, dangerous promiscuity, origin ungraspable, the violence of forgetting, auxiliary meaning not living (not spontaneous); representation mingles (s’enlace) w/ what it represents; infinite reference (renvoi): le double dédouble ce qu’il redouble
OG.linkedContent: to think writing first, a perversion, dangerous promiscuity, origin ungraspable, the violence of forgetting, auxiliary meaning not living (not spontaneous); representation mingles (s’enlace) w/ what it represents; infinite reference (renvoi): le double dédouble ce qu’il redouble

OG.content: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude
OG.linkedContent: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude

SPEC.content: Beyond… and Das Unheimliche: devil comes back neither as imaginary representation, nor as an apparition in person: devil comes back “in person” to double his double…a doubling doubling his double, devil overflows his double at moment he’s nothing but his double
SPEC.linkedContent: Beyond… and Das Unheimliche: devil comes back neither as imaginary representation, nor as an apparition in person: devil comes back “in person” to double his double…a doubling doubling his double, devil overflows his double at moment he’s nothing but his double

SPEC.content: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”
SPEC.linkedContent: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”

SPEC.content: visitation of devil, apparition of “thing in itself,” over & above representative that’s supposed to supplement him, supplement of its “own supplement”: expands double-effects, upsets appeasing order of representation, duplicity w/out original > for Rousseau, diabolical brings fright to a climax
SPEC.linkedContent: visitation of devil, apparition of “thing in itself,” over & above representative that’s supposed to supplement him, supplement of its “own supplement”: expands double-effects, upsets appeasing order of representation, duplicity w/out original > for Rousseau, diabolical brings fright to a climax

FV.content: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber] me
FV.linkedContent: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber] me

FV.content: Lacan forecloses the double w/out mercy, contains it in the imaginary > imaginary/symbolic duality controls Unheimlichkeit, the anguishing disarray (l’affolement angoissant) (w/out hope of closure, reappropriation, or truth) provoked by references (renvois) from simulacrum to simulacrum, double to double
FV.linkedContent: Lacan forecloses the double w/out mercy, contains it in the imaginary > imaginary/symbolic duality controls Unheimlichkeit, the anguishing disarray (l’affolement angoissant) (w/out hope of closure, reappropriation, or truth) provoked by references (renvois) from simulacrum to simulacrum, double to double

FV.content: analysand seeing his/her double: “uncontrollable anxiety” disrupts every verification of identity, obstacle for transference
FV.linkedContent: analysand seeing his/her double: “uncontrollable anxiety” disrupts every verification of identity, obstacle for transference

FV.content: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
FV.linkedContent: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]

FV.content: the fancy (fantastique) of an identification btwn 2 doubled doubles, the narrator inside what he narrates, makes [Lacan’s] triangular logic very limited play w/in the play
FV.linkedContent: the fancy (fantastique) of an identification btwn 2 doubled doubles, the narrator inside what he narrates, makes [Lacan’s] triangular logic very limited play w/in the play

FV.content: [re: narrator identifying w/ Dupin in Purloined…] if dual relation btwn 2 doubles overflows & simulates symbolic: opposition imaginary/symbolic has little pertinence

FV.content: position of each character identifies itself w/ the other & divides itself: even the position du mort (dummy) and of a supplementary 4th [beyond triangle] [all characters occupy all positions]

FV.content: double, Unheimlichkeit, doesn’t belong to triad, triangle carried into a labyrinth of doubles, w/out original, fac-similes
